Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel + staff stole my shirt.”
Reviews.Author: angie_sims112
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel x 3 nights. it looked ok from the outside but when coming into the room the nightmare begins- hairs in the bathtub...stained sheets, and hairs on the toilet seat. :/ no soap, shampoo or anything else in the shower. (and that is supposed to be a 4 star hotel) breakfast was poor.. no normal coffee not even hot water to make a cup of tea. saw the staff putting back uneaten food... horrible. and then on my last day to make this "lovey" stay completed. staff stole my favourite shirt from my room. needles to say it was never found in the laundry room like claimed. to sum up- make yourself a favor don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've attended to”
Reviews.Author: Orengivi
Reviews.Content: Took 3 nights in the hotel, location is not so great (5-10 minutes from the Ramblas). Worst issue was that the maid stole few shirts from my girlfriend and after complaining and left our details - we had no feedback - but this is not everything. I travelled a lot and visited high quality and low qualiry hotel but this one was very bad: Room was small and dirty. The sheets seemed to be dirty and not washed. We noticed some human hair that was in the bathtub and around the toilet when we got in, smell was bad and the handle for the window was removed so no window can be opened. Unfortunately, breakfast seemed to be cheap and not satisfying, the cultury, plates and glasses was dirty and it was really a shame. I noticed the cleaning lady returning pastries that was not eaten to the fresh baskets - we were shoked. Very bad experience, I don't understand why they get 4 stars - I will recommend not going there.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ch00ch85
Reviews.Content: we are from israel and took 2 nights in this hotel. the crew is very nice and the roon is very comfterble. great location. take it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OlgaMK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very clean, comfortable, and most important thing, very close to the center of Barcelona and most famous street La Rambla! If I go again in Barcelona, I will stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: shay a
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel My wife and I were at the hotel a central location great staff We strongly recommend

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: ben1200
Reviews.Content: Incredible location near plaza Catalunia very friendly staff and clean rooms(wifi) but with no view of the city at least where i stayed. Nice breakfast with only one argument for me: Really terrible coffee

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views on this hotel, good location but staff mmmmm”
Reviews.Author: james S
Reviews.Content: The Breakfast was below par for a 4 Star hotel, partic the hot portion, having recently stayed at the Hilton (Edinburgh), Ramada Jarvis (Manchester), Novotel (Paris), I am able to make the comparison. On a more serious note the check in at 15:00 was poorly handled by the reception staff, arriving at 14:30 I politely inquired about an early checkin, the reception staff pointed to the card on the Desk and said that 15:00 was standard for Spain. She didn't even ask Housekeeping if anything was available, that was unprofessional, unhelpful and rude. Poor business instinct at worst business suicide at worst, its not a good idea to alienate your customer base,especially 4 star. If she had made a good business case I might have been mollified. If I was the Manager I would be disappointed that reception were not able to handle a simple matter graciously. Po faced and obdurate come instantly to mind. If I was the owner I would be horrified and ashamed at the woeful standard of hospitality offered.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep after long day work”
Reviews.Author: pschubert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel sansi a few times, and I have always been received with a large smile. This time the same, I arrived around 9 pm in the evening and I was the last one to check in, the receptionist was already waiting for me and had everything prepared. As I had rented a Car, the receptionist offered me to park it in the Hotels parking, for a small amount. Parking is very small. Breakfast was good. I will definately go back to this hotel because of it's Location, the friendly staff and the value for money. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not very firendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Titagusten
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and two children, 15 and 11) had booked two rooms for three nights. When we arrived late in the evening, there was no room for us. We had to go to another hotel and the hotel Diputacio didn´t even pay a taxi. On the next day we didn´t get our rooms until three o´clock in the afternoon, at separate floors. In the first room we got there was somebody elses´s luggage. - Obviously we waren´t the only ones,who had to go to another hotel (we saw and heard at least one angry woman). When we checked out I payed a bottle of water in coins to a man in the reception and pointed out that there was a half drunken bottle of water in the mini bar that was not ours. Still, when I got back home the hotel had charge my Visa card for something (about 3 euros). The rooms were pretty good, the breakfast excellent and the breakfast staff friendly. The reception seems to have big problems - zero control and unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “good stay in sansi”
Reviews.Author: serena091
Reviews.Content: hotel staff were very friendly and helpful room was nicely decorated although there shower leaked a bit so there was smell of dampness but window opened wide like a door (am i wrong in thinking that a lot of hotels could smell like this in a large city) no english speaking tv channels although we had free wi fi which was very good except the cable did not allow the laptop to leave the table disco across the road did wake us alright hotel in good location, nice restraunts nearby easy to find. cent focs, cervecia catalynua on mallorca breakfast was well stocked with plenty of meats, cheese, bread cereal nice coffee altho poorly stocked at weekends better mid week (nice helpful girl must get the weekends off) nothing chilled though, missed that but the coffee and chocolate croissants were lovely. fruit available too. 2 blocks from placa catalyunia excellent walking distance. nice area, plenty of nice shops closeby espirit and zara. would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a 10-minutes walk away from the station & tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: gachen1
Reviews.Content: A clean, elegant and hotel at the heart of the city with good value and decent facilities, including free high-speed internet. The beds were comfortable and the restroom was quite nicely designed and spacious. The breakfast was good and the staffs were professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kitsa2010
Reviews.Content: We got the room in 3 hours late!!! (AFTER CHECK-IN TIME) The room wasn't clean at all!! The workers in the reception was so rude and not polite, the service there is BAD! it's really seems that you are talking to yourself...and no one is listening to you... the breakfast was poor!!! and they didnt have any waking call service (at the day of our flight)... unrecommended !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel at a fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: scottmarsha11
Reviews.Content: not really sure about the negative reviews on here. my experience couldn't have been more different. got a good deal on this place online staying for a week. the room was clean and modern and well laid out (not sure about the glass door between the bedroom and bathroom though!) and the staff were friendly and v. helpful. would recommend. and stay here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, I can recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraBC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in Sansi Diputacio Barcelona. The location is perfect. Not is a crowded street. A couple minutes walk to the Ramblas. Close to the placa Catalunya. The breakfast was very nice. Warm croissants, chocolate croissants, diverse.. nice coffee The rooms are a little bit too small, but the servie was excellent. There were two boys who helped us perfectly with everything! They were so good in their job explained us all our questions. We had the best stay in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: JobozLeicester
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean - The bathroom door I think would be an issue especially if you were with someone who you didnt know very well as it certainly gives you no privacy when sitting on the loo. Breakfast was OK usual continental stuff but was not staffed very well and therefore was not replenished very often and items had been standing for a long time. Staff were very friendly and helpful - the hotel was quiet - it is a fair walk from the touristy part of Las Ramblas but there are plenty of bars on the way and the bar opposite the hotel was good and did not interefere with the hotel noise wise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AliceNetherlands
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies in a quiet neighbourhood with a nice atmosphere and only a 5 minute walk from the Rambla de Cataluna. As we had expected, on our arrival at 10.30 a.m. our rooms were not ready. We could leave our luggage in the lounge untill our return at 3 p.m. The desk personnel was friendly and our rooms on the 6th floor were clean and tidy every day when we got back. The airco worked well without making too much noise. We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. On one night our teenage daugther and son went out and got back around 2 a.m. The walk from the old town to the hotel seemed save to us even at this time of night. Breakfast was simple, but adequate. Making your own coffee with the retro espresso machine was a bit difficult for most of the guests, but nice to watch. On the second day we arrived in the breakfast room a little later than the day before, at 9.30 instead of 9.00, and found that the croissants and the ham and cheese etc. were already finished and they did not refill the plates. That was the only slightly unpleasant experience during our stay. On the last day we asked the desk clerk if we could have a late check out, as our flight would not leave untill 8.30 p.m. and we would like to keep one of the 2 rooms untill 6 p.m. to change and freshen up He did his best to accommodate us, but unfortunately the latest check out time was at 3, as it was a Sunday and the rooms had to be cleaned before 4 p.m. which we understood. Anyway he tried and had a positive attitude. Again we left our luggage in the hall while sightseeing and when we returned he ordered a taxi for us to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “my kids were not made wellcome”
Reviews.Author: robertmuckian
Reviews.Content: my family of 5 just spent 5 days in the Sansi Diputacio 4* from the minute we arrived my kids were not wellcomed . they are not noisey kids . my youngest child is 2 years old , they were constantly complaining to us about her touching the glass items ( fish tanks ,doors , tables ) it was an absolute nightmare . we book a twin room and we were given a dolls house . i expected two double beds , i got two single beds instead . i went to the reception and i made it clear that the room that was in the web site was not the room i had recieved , they just replied theres was nothing they could do unless i paid more money for an upgrade . there was also glass doors on the toliet nightmare. the breakfast set up is totally unexceptable by any standard . the size of the rooms are small in perportion . there was one member of staff that tried to help , he will go far ( nice guy ) it would be a nice place to go as a couple not as a family . it was clean and tidy that at least is a plus . i paid the extra for the bigger room , this helped this reveiw .

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: watchingu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights from 26/6/08..def not 4 star..Breakfasts were appalling e.g. rubbery tomatoes,2 types of inedable chipolatas and a pile of fat which was supposed to be bacon...no cereal spoons,stale bread rolls,no bread left for toast ,no water for tea and milk that was sour.Bathrooms need a door on and not a glass panel.Noise from cafe across road till 7a.m at weekends and air con barely worked.towels looked jaded and well used and the room safe did not work.The bar was closed most of the time On the plus side most staff were friendly and helpfull and the location 2 mins from las ramblas was fine. It has the appearance of a hotel being run on a shoestring .With a bit more ambition it could be quite a nice hotel but because of the size of the rooms no more than 3 star

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: paula048
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, very clean and comfortable. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and we were able to leave our luggage until the evening of our departure. The breakfast buffet was well varied, the only suggestion would be an extra coffee machine as a queue formed at busy times.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterJo
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Sansi Diputacio for three nights, and would have no hesitation in going back or recommending it to friends. The staff were helpful, the rooms were clean and well-presented, and the continental breakfast was a good start to the day. The location is near perfect - only two blocks up from the Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas, close to the Gaudi sites but benefitting from the quieter side street location. As other reviews have pointed out - Yes, the rooms are on the small side (as you would expect from a City centre hotel!), but the decor is stylish and well maintained. If you're sharing a room with someone, make sure you know them well - the uber-cool bathroom door does not afford much privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Congresstraveler
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location in the "uptown" area - less touristy but good shopping and dining and nicer atmosphere than at Ramblas. Gaudi buildings, metro and airport busses are close. Clean hotel with modern rooms. Cons: poor breakfast (too little choice for the price), bathroom door is a see-thru version and mold smells in the bathroom even though it looks very new.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: karen_nga
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasts about its four star rating but its more like a 2 or 3 star in terms of the size of the rooms, the functionality of the restroom, and the hospitality (which there was essentially very little of). The rooms were way too small bc the beds took up most of the room. I stayed with my mom and we're both petite women but we found this place very cramped. Also, the bathroom is ridiculous bc the door is clear and the shower door only covers half the shower (this door is also clear) so there was always water on the floor. Final words: find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “'Superb-cannot believe other reviews'”
Reviews.Author: IanStHelens
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through 'Octopus Travel' as is was a good price and it was one of their top picks. I booked this for my wife's birthday gift so I was very worried about some of the previous reviews i had read on this website. our experience could not be any different. The reception desk staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating and friendly. Upon arriving they checked us in very quickly and even though it was 3 hours before we were due to have our room, they insisted on taking our cases straight up and give us our room with no extra charge. The room itself was great. A very comfortable bed, bathroom with a huge shower, air conditioning and everything clean which it was kept like that everyday. On going out to explore the desk staff again were very friendly and asked if they could be of any assistance and told us not to hesitate to ask them for help. All I can say is that I would definitely go back to this hotel and cannot understand some of the comments left by other user's. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Experience”
Reviews.Author: danieladam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in October 2006 through a travel agent as it was for my 40th Birthday and I was going with 6 friends. Needless to say we were all looking forward to our trip to Barcelona immensely. Four of us arrived from Birmingham on a Thursday night approximately 11pm. to be greeted by the hotel porter who informed us that the hotel was full. We explained that we had made and paid for our reservations months ago. He explained that the computer system went down the day before and had lost all bookings. This was quite obviously a lie. He explained that he would have to try and find us a local hotel in the area for the night. He spent one hour on the phone ringing around but to no avail. Eventually he offered us a drink at the closed bar, no other staff in the hotel. He was very rude and adamant that this in fact was no fault of his. Finally at 1am. he contacted a sister hotel and found us two twin rooms, how convenient. We are still wondering why he didn't try them in the first place and it would of saved us two ours of an already stressful night. He explained that we get a taxi to the hotel and back to the original hotel, to keep the receipts and we would be reimbursed and that our rooms would be ready the next morning. The sister hotel was approx. 15mins. away by taxi, when we arrived we were greeted by a friendly receptionist who had our keys ready. We took the lift to the fourth floor where our rooms were and when we got to the floor we founf that there were no lights on in the hallway, once the lift door was shut it was complete darkness. We had to use a mobile phone to find the room number. We came back down for a very well earned drink and explained about the lights, she had to bring us back up with a torch. 4* I don't think so. The next morning we got a taxi back to our original hotel Sansi Diputacio only to find that the rooms would not be ready until 3pm., this was 10am. At this point we have yet to see any of Barcelona, hang up our clothes or get settled. The receptionist then blamed the incident on the travel agency we booked it with which was nonsense. We couldn't understand why there were no rooms ready knowing that cleaning staff started at 7am. only to be told the staff were on a training course. At this point we just could not believe what was happening. We then explained that we needed to be reimbursed for the taxi journey. After much negotiation they agreed to pay for the taxi to the hotel the night before but not for the return journey as it was not company policy. At this point we felt it best to leave the hotel and go for a walk. When we eventually got in to our rooms we were told that we could not open the windows as it was against the law but the only problem was that the air conditioning was not working. The hotel was boiling. I cannot express enough how badly treated we were. I would never recommend this hotel chain to anybody if it was the last place on earth. My birthday celebrations were completely ruined and we never at any stage got an apology. All in all - apalling.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: arekuna
Reviews.Content: Even though the location is quite good (few steps from Plaza Catalunya or Paseo de Gracia), I was quite dissappointed of this Hotel. The rooms looked shabby, even though renovated (suppose some years ago). There was a certain smell which I could not define and the windows from inside (there was some kind of yard and a small small square around which the hotel was built) did not get much fresh air and transported every noise from 2 floors below (if the window was open as well). the sheets were not the cleanest ones neither. personnel was very friendly though...

Reviews.Title: “to bad to be true”
Reviews.Author: huska
Reviews.Content: i stayed 1 night on january 1, first we were assigned a room that had not been cleaned (at 6 in the afternoon) we were given another room but this one had no water, this resolved we had no hot water (we were told by other guests that this problem was 4 days old) we were imformed that this problem was outside the hotel. At 10.:30 we went to the lounge area and the receptionist practicly kiked us away closing the tv and telling us we could not stay there. The room although modern were filled with defects, like electric cables hanging. I don´t know how this is a 4 star hotel. stay away from this hotel if you can

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcoming environment”
Reviews.Author: jeniwren21
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews before setting off my fiance and I were positively terrified of what we might find at this hotel. On arriving we were greeted by 3 members of staff, our cases were immediately taken from us and carried to our room for us as we checked in. A map was produced where one of the staff members pointed out where the hotel was and gave us information on where all the main attractions were and how to get to them. We were then taken to our room where the helpful staff member showed us how to work all the amenities. We were very pleasantly surprised at our room as we had expected to find no toiletries, no towels and broken windows from the reviews we had read. The rooms are lovely, if a little on the small side, all done in wood panelling. There was every toiletry imaginable in the bathroom, along with 4 large towels and a bathrobe and pair of slippers which I was very impressed with. The rooms were cleaned daily and we were even left a second robe and pair of slippers after the first day - we were also given fresh robes. I'm sure if you were looking for things to complain about then you could find something. There were a few tiles missing from the shower and the rooms could probably use a little more maintenance but overall I couldn't find fault with the place. The breakfasts were perhaps not the best I've ever had - there was not a huge variety but we always left with full stomachs. The staff were lovely, always making an effort to speak to you when you left or returned, asking how you enjoyed your day and helping you find places. I would advise that you take advantage of the Bus Turistic which is 21 euros for a 2 day pass and you can get on or off at all the major sights as often as you like (you can pick the bus up at Plaza de Catalunya) There is also an airport bus from just outside the airport that takes you directly to Plaza de Catalunya so the hotel is very conveniently located. We did find that eating out was a bit of a problem - most of the restuarants tend to be more cafe/bars where u sit at the bar and eat your food there. We had been looking forward to splashing out on some nice meals in restaurants. If you try further down La Rambla we found a few more places there. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend this hotel. We sustained no bites from bed bugs (As complained about by a previous reviewer - I suspect these may have been misquito bites). If you are looking for the Hilton then stay in the Hilton. If you are looking for your basic city hotel with a touch of class then try this one.

Reviews.Title: “Find yourself another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linus123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sansi for 5 days in August 2006. Can you imagine a 4-star hotel that is dirty with dust everywhere, with stain in the bathtub, with stained towels, have to ask to get the right number of towels everynight, with slow breakfast service, who use water to dilute the hand soap and shower soap (I have to go to supermarket and bought my own shower gel in the end)? Though the location is good, you can get a much better experience at this price. Go find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star standard. Very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 4 star but facilities would only rate 2 or 3 compared with other places I've stayed. A small over-priced bar in the lobby. No restaurant except a rather average breakfast room. Room was the noisiest room I've ever stayed in & I've stayed in some very noisy places in my time! Even for a city hotel, noise was incredible. Sound insulation was non-existent, the club opposite generated loud noise some nights (not music but people in the street shouting and whistling as only over-exuberant young people & drunks can) and overnight deliveries to the bars nearby involved the dropping of many metal beer kegs and crates of bottles. Traffic noise until 3 or 4 am. There were occasional periods of comparative quiet between 5 & 6 am before the traffic started up again. In the bathroom (with its glass door!) you could hear the seagulls on the roof 6 floors above as well as every flush and emptying sink. The noises came down the service ducting. Noisy airconditioning too! Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel really good. It is in a fantastic location being a short walk from Plaza de Catalunya and the Ramblas but still situated in a nice quiet area. We found the glass bathroom door quite amusing but it does give some privacy as it is patterned and does not look directly on to the main part of the room. It wasn't particularly luxurious for what I would have expected of a four-star but it was very clean, bright and modern. The staff were excellent. Most spoke English and were so helpful both in hotel matters and more general advice about the city. We were made to feel very welcome and one receptionist even took time to help me with my limited attempts at Catalan.

Reviews.Title: “Careless and hostile management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Think twice before booking ! This people don't care if you stay there: No soap in bathroom, twice out of 5 days rooms were not cleaned by 18:00 (when asked front desk says they clean by order of check out but why should you care ?), one of 2 elevators doesn't reach 7 floor, service at breakfast is very very slow. When talking to management they care about the nice outside fasade but not about those already in. Do yourself a favour, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs from a four star!”
Reviews.Author: wantmore
Reviews.Content: This hotel although central is very poor for a four star. We had to have three different rooms in the end. The first night room 409 the window would not close and we were kept awake by the noise of cars and scooters all night. The second night I got bitten by bedbugs on my arms and legs room 605 and in the final room 605 the safe wouldn't work. In addition to this there are no toiletries (except for a basic soap dispenser) not even tissues, no pens pencils or paper, every room had something missing like plugs for the sink, bidet or bath, leaky bidet or missing bathroom shelf. Also the glass door to the bathroom was disconcerting. Last time I was in barcelona I stayed in a three star Best Western which was fine - but this hotel was just "style" painted over a crap.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed and relieved!”
Reviews.Author: Striker54
Reviews.Content: I was more then a little worried after booking my stay at this hotel when I read some of the reviews on this site but the hotel was great. We arrived and had drinks at the bar. True there were no cocktails and we had to mime certain things to the bar man but measures were huge, there was a pianist playing and everything looked very smart. The rooms were good. True having a glass bathroom door is a little odd but at least it was an amusing conversation piece. The air con for all 4 rooms we had worked perfectly well and the beds were extremely comfortable. Location is great - 5 mins walk from Ramblas but totally quiet at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone going to Barcelona on a budget but who wants to stay somewhere clean, smart, convenient and relaxing.

HotelInfo.Name: Sansi Diputacio Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Diputacio 234 - 236, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
